quiz.title: Web Development Quiz
quiz.description: Test your knowledge of HTML, CSS, and core web concepts including accessibility and performance.

questions.question: Which HTML tag is used to define the most important heading?
CSS Flexbox is ideal for one-dimensional layouts.
questions.explanation: Flexbox is optimized for one-dimensional layouts; Grid is for two-dimensional layouts.

questions.question: Which attribute improves accessibility by providing text for screen readers on images?
questions.explanation: The alt attribute provides alternative text for images.

questions.question: To minimize reflow and repaint, which practice is recommended?

options.text: Modify styles one-by-one in a loop
Use inline styles for all elements
Force layout with getBoundingClientRect in loops

questions.explanation: Batching DOM reads and writes reduces layout thrashing and improves performance.

questions.question: Which HTTP header is used to enable cross-origin resource sharing (CORS) for specific origins?
questions.explanation: Access-Control-Allow-Origin specifies which origins are permitted to access the resource.

questions.question: CSS Grid can create both rows and columns simultaneously, making it suitable for two-dimensional layouts.
questions.explanation: Grid excels at two-dimensional layouts unlike Flexbox which is one-dimensional.
